title: Server connection drops cause premature game end and player disconnections
description:
JBoss remoting connections between the XMage server and headless clients fail mid-game, causing cascading player disconnections. The server's callback channel throws `java.io.IOException: Unable to create socket`, then the game freezes in `waitResponseOpen` for 30 seconds, and eventually players are disconnected.

In the worst case (game_20260210_224830), the entire game ended at Turn 5 after ~15 minutes due to a `LeasePinger` / `ConnectionValidator` timeout.

Evidence:
- ~/.mage-bench/logs/game_20260210_234611/server.log line 70-71: `Game frozen in waitResponseOpen for 30 secs` then `SESSION CALLBACK EXCEPTION - java.io.IOException: Unable to create socket` at 00:10:27
- ~/.mage-bench/logs/game_20260210_234611/server.log line 73: second socket failure at 01:03:08
- ~/.mage-bench/logs/game_20260210_234611/server.log lines 72,74,76: 3 of 4 players disconnected progressively
- ~/.mage-bench/logs/game_20260210_224830/Gem3 ESPN_pilot.log line 887: `Could not connect to server!` at 23:05:21, game ended at Turn 5

Possible causes: socket pool exhaustion under 4 concurrent LLM clients, slow LLM responses blocking the client's ability to process server callbacks, or JBoss remoting lease expiration. The 30-second `waitResponseOpen` timeout may be too short for LLM-driven clients.

Suggested investigation: Check JBoss remoting configuration (lease period, socket timeout, connection pool size). The headless client may need keep-alive or reconnection logic.
